Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Shriner's Hospital for Children Stories of Love
Sabrina
programme.desc: Chauffeur's daughter Sabrina (Audrey Hepburn) returns home from two years in Paris a beautiful young woman, and immediately catches the attention of David (William Holden), the playboy son of her father's rich employers. David woos and wins Sabrina, who has always been in love with him, however their romance is threatened by David's serious older brother, Linus (Humphrey Bogart), who runs the family business and is relying on David to marry an heiress in order for a crucial merger to take place.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: The head (Charlton Heston) of a Hawaiian pineapple dynasty refuses to let his sister (Yvette Mimieux) marry a native.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The luck of Pat Brennan (Randolph Scott) is about to go from bad to worse; after gambling his horse away, he gets a ride from Willard (John Hubbard) and Doretta Mims (Maureen O'Sullivan). Soon, their stagecoach is hijacked by a trio of merciless bandits, led by the especially heartless Frank Usher (Richard Boone). As Usher holds the coach passengers hostage, Brennan falls in love with Doretta and develops a risky plan to free himself and the Mimses, leading to a bloody final standoff.

programme.title: Rancho Notorious
programme.desc: Vern Haskell (Arthur Kennedy) is pushed to revenge when his fiancée is killed during a general store robbery. Intent on punishing those responsible, Vern manages to find one of the thieves, who is mortally wounded. In his dying words, the man gives Vern a clue to finding the others. Continuing his quest, Vern travels to the hideout -- a ranch operated by Altar Keane (Marlene Dietrich), a former saloon singer. By fooling an outlaw (Mel Ferrer), Vern makes his way into their inner circle.

programme.title: Big Jim McLain
programme.desc: Jim McLain (John Wayne) and his partner, Mal Baxter (James Arness), are investigators for the House Un-American Activities Committee, who are sent to Hawaii to find the leaders of a local Communist Party. They visit Dr. Gelster (Gayne Whitman), a psychiatrist who is treating one of the party members. While there, McLain charms the doctor's secretary, Nancy Vallon (Nancy Olson), and asks her out. As their hunt continues, McLain and Baxter become targets of Communist boss Sturak (Alan Napier).

programme.title: Gidget Goes Hawaiian
programme.desc: In this sequel to the hit 1959 film "Gidget," Francie "Gidget" Lawrence (Deborah Walley) is once again involved with her boyfriend, Jeff "Moondoggie" Matthews (James Darren). However, they have a lovers' spat, and Gidget goes to sulk in Hawaii with her parents. In the islands, she meets TV dancer Eddie Horner (Michael Callan). Seeing how miserable she's become, Gidget's wise dad (Carl Reiner) sends for Moondoggie, and the couple reunite just as Gidget gets romantic with Eddie.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: During the 1850s, Milly (Jane Powell), a pretty young cook, marries Adam (Howard Keel), a grizzled woodsman, after a brief courtship. When the two return to Adam's farm, Milly is shocked to meet his six ill-mannered brothers, all of whom live in his cabin. She promptly begins teaching the brothers proper behavior, and most importantly, how to court a woman. But after the brothers kidnap six local girls during a town barn-raising, a group of indignant villagers tries to track them down.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes and Watson match wits with an opera star intent on blackmailing a king.

programme.title: That Texas Jamboree
programme.desc: In 1890, Curt Chambers, the new sheriff of Crescent City, is disgraced when the crooked mayor forces him to shut down a popular medicine show. To save his reputation and a romance, Curt has the medicine tested to prove its value.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The seemingly meaningless destruction of six busts of Napoleon intrigues Holmes.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp goes under cover as an outlaw to nab thief and murderer Blackie Saunders, but Blackie's men prevent the two from meeting, leading Earp to find shelter near their camp.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A gang of outlaws takes advantage of Earp's absence by attacking Dodge City in full force and demanding that Mayor Kelley pay them $20,000 and fire Earp; Earp looks for the fastest way back to town while Shotgun Gibbs lends a hand to stop the gang.

programme.desc: Vern Haskell (Arthur Kennedy) is pushed to revenge when his fiancée is killed during a general store robbery. Continuing his quest, Vern travels to the hideout -- a ranch operated by Altar Keane (Marlene Dietrich), a former saloon singer. By fooling an outlaw (Mel Ferrer), Vern makes his way into their inner circle.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: During the 1850s, Milly (Jane Powell), a pretty young cook, marries Adam (Howard Keel), a grizzled woodsman, after a brief courtship. When the two return to Adam's farm, Milly is shocked to meet his six ill-mannered brothers, all of whom live in his cabin. She promptly begins teaching the brothers proper behavior, and most importantly, how to court a woman. But after the brothers kidnap six local girls during a town barn-raising, a group of indignant villagers tries to track them down.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: West Side Story
programme.desc: A musical in which a modern day Romeo and Juliet are involved in New York street gangs. On the harsh streets of the upper west side, two gangs battle for control of the turf. The situation becomes complicated when a gang members falls in love with a rival's sister.

programme.title: Hawaii
programme.desc: During the 1820s, a domineering young minister, Abner Hale (Max von Sydow), and his compassionate wife, Jerusha (Julie Andrews), embark on a dangerous sea voyage to Hawaii. When they arrive, Jerusha befriends the Hawaiian people and embraces their customs and culture, while Abner, intent on converting them to Christianity, views them as pagan savages. Jerusha grows unhappy with her marriage and begins to fall for Rafer Hoxworth (Richard Harris), a past lover.

programme.desc: Well-meaning sailors and a conniving uncle place an entertainer (Lupe Velez) in the Miss Honolulu contest under two different identities.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: The Law and Jake Wade
programme.desc: Bandits Clint Hollister (Richard Widmark) and Jake Wade (Robert Taylor) botch a robbery that ends with Clint imprisoned. Despairing, Jake leaves the loot in an abandoned village and quits crime for good. Now working for the law, Jake helps free his old cohort from jail. Clint doesn't want the treasure to go to waste, however, so he forces Jake and his girlfriend, Peggy (Patricia Owens), to lead him to the stash. But to unearth the money, they'll have to get past dangerous Comanche warriors.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Jim Kipp (Randolph Scott) is a bounty hunter hired to find three robbers who committed a daring heist three years ago. When he arrives in a small town near the robbery, he senses that the thieves may be living there. However, many of the townspeople -- including Dr. Spencer (Harry Antrim), his daughter, Julie (Dolores Dorn), and barmaid Alice (Marie Windsor) -- are put on edge by Kipp's presence and want him gone. Kipp perseveres, hatching a plan that he thinks will draw out the bandits.

programme.title: Sabrina
programme.desc: Chauffeur's daughter Sabrina (Audrey Hepburn) returns home from two years in Paris a beautiful young woman, and immediately catches the attention of David (William Holden), the playboy son of her father's rich employers. David woos and wins Sabrina, who has always been in love with him, however their romance is threatened by David's serious older brother, Linus (Humphrey Bogart), who runs the family business and is relying on David to marry an heiress in order for a crucial merger to take place.

programme.title: In Harm's Way
programme.desc: Naval Captain Torrey (John Wayne) manages to bring his ship through the bombing of Pearl Harbor unscathed, but is later demoted when it is damaged in a subsequent battle due to his negligence. Back on land, he begins a reconciliation with his estranged son (Brandon de Wilde) and a romance with nurse Maggie (Patricia Neal), but duty calls him away when he and his firebrand friend, Cmdr. Paul Eddington (Kirk Douglas), are tasked with salvaging a dangerous and important mission.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Bobbie Jo falls for Alan Landman (Dennis Hopper), a poet and beatnik.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: The Dodge City bank installs a new alarm in response to a rash of robberies; brothers Matt and Clint Dunbar rob the bank in disguise, but when deputies set up checkpoints on the roads, they stash the money and look for another way out of town.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Big Jake
programme.desc: The avenging head of the McCandle clan returns to his estranged family and leads the search for his kidnapped grandson. Big Jake sets off, his sons in tow, to deliver the ransom to the kidnappers, but has little intention of handing it over without a fight.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An embittered Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her cowardly husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, the scout stays on to help for a while and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: Calamity Jane
programme.desc: In the lonely Deadwood, Dakota, territory, sharpshooter Calamity Jane (Doris Day) falls for cavalry Lt. Danny Gilmartin (Philip Carey) when she is forced to rescue him from the Indians. Recognizing that the women-starved townsmen long for a "real" woman, Calamity journeys to Chicago to bring back famous singer Adelaid Adams, but mistakenly brings her maid Katie instead. Heartbroken when Danny falls for Katie, Calamity all but ignores her jovial friend Wild Bill Hickok (Howard Keel).

programme.title: Day of the Evil Gun
programme.desc: Returning home after disappearing three years ago, former gunslinger Lorn Warfield (Glenn Ford) finds that an Apache raiding party has kidnapped his wife and children. Though he has renounced violence, he now takes up his gun and joins forces with his neighbor, Owen Forbes (Arthur Kennedy). Complicating matters, Forbes is engaged to Warfield's wife, who believed her husband was dead. As they pursue the Apaches, the two men are joined by an Indian trader, Jimmy Noble (Dean Jagger).

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.desc: Three men play dirty tricks to charm a beautiful young woman.

programme.desc: Earp rides to Oklahoma in search of a killer who stabbed his cousin Nate and volunteers to join a group of cattle drivers, one of whom owns a knife similar to the murder weapon.

programme.desc: A gambling queen (Marie Windsor) and her henchwomen run things until a U.S. marshal (Richard Rober) comes to town.

programme.desc: At Fort Bridger in the Wyoming Territory, frontiersman and scout Kit Carson (Jon Hall) receives a request to guide a wagon train over the Oregon Trail to California. Concerned by the dangers of Indian attacks, Carson hesitates, but then agrees despite the wagon train having already arranged for protection from a cavalry unit led by Capt. John Fremont (Dana Andrews). On the journey, Caron and Fremont clash several times over leadership -- and the attentions of Dolores Murphy (Lynn Bari).

This year, their adult daughter, Chelsea (Jane Fonda), visits with her new fiancée and his teenage son, Billy (Doug McKeon) on their way to Europe. programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen
programme.desc: Karen Mills was a county court judge and criminal defense attorney in Florida before turning to TV to preside over her own court shows. In her third effort, "Supreme Justice," Mills tackles small-claims court arbitrations in her compassionate way, to which viewers of her previous shows have grown accustomed. As usual with court shows, cases involve friendships gone bad, money disputes and property damage.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen

programme.title: Justice With Judge Mablean
programme.desc: Judge Mablean Ephriam, who presided over "Divorce Court" from 1999-2006 as the first star of the revived version of the show, returns to the courtroom genre with his half-hour series that deals with life and the law. The former Los Angeles-based prosecutor takes on the typical cases that are found on TV court shows. The arbitrator says that her show "will be life because everything we do, it involves the law."

programme.desc: In this weekly program, Dr. David Jeremiah delivers practical messages to the congregation at the Shadow Mountain Community Church in San Diego. programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben Cartwright is the patriarch of an all-male Nevada ranching family. Set during and after the Civil War, "Bonanza" is the story of life on the family's thousand-acre spread, known as the Ponderosa, near Virginia City. Ben has his three sons, each with a different (and deceased) mother. Serious eldest son Adam hopes to follow in his father's footsteps; middle son Hoss is a gentle giant -- physically strong, but sometimes naive; and youngest son Little Joe is the most impetuous and romantic of the offspring.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: Biz Kids
programme.desc: Teaching financial education and entrepreneurship to a preteen audience; using sketch comedy and young actors to explain basic economic concepts.

programme.title: Sports Stars of Tomorrow
programme.desc: Profiles of the top rookie, college and high-school talent in sports; current athletes share their experiences, advice and personal impressions of the road to stardom.

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Git Along, Little Dogies
programme.desc: To protect his land from the possibility of pollution, ranch owner Gene Autry (Gene Autry) sides with fellow ranchers who are fighting the plans of banker Maxwell (William Farnum), who wants to drill oil wells. But when Gene realizes the discovery of oil would bring a railroad to the area and create much-needed jobs, he switches sides. Conniving local businessman George Wilkins (Weldon Heyburn) turns investors against Gene and Maxwell, however, hoping to slip in and take over the oil business.

programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash -- up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Contestants get a chance to win money, from one penny to $1 million.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more -- prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show -- with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot -- as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run) and hosted until his death in 2020.

Alex Trebek began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run) and hosted until his death in 2020.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show -- with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot -- as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run) and hosted until his death in 2020.

programme.title: Bone Collector
programme.desc: "Bone Collector" is one of the Outdoor Channel's most popular programs. Since premiering in 2009, the series has collected millions of fans by focusing on the culture of the hunter and not exclusively on the kill. According to host Michael Waddell, a hunter is more than a predator; a hunter is a provider, a caretaker, and a leader, and this show aims to promote that philosophy at every turn. Waddell is joined by co-hosts Nick Mundt and Travis "T-Bone" Turner for "warts and all" adventures that take them from Africa to Alaska, and the hunts are geared toward a variety of implements, including bow, muzzleloader, shotgun and rifle.

programme.title: Bone Collector
programme.desc: "Bone Collector" is one of the Outdoor Channel's most popular programs. Since premiering in 2009, the series has collected millions of fans by focusing on the culture of the hunter and not exclusively on the kill. According to host Michael Waddell, a hunter is more than a predator; a hunter is a provider, a caretaker, and a leader, and this show aims to promote that philosophy at every turn. Waddell is joined by co-hosts Nick Mundt and Travis "T-Bone" Turner for "warts and all" adventures that take them from Africa to Alaska, and the hunts are geared toward a variety of implements, including bow, muzzleloader, shotgun and rifle.

programme.title: This Gun for Hire
programme.desc: (1942) Classic noir starring Alan Ladd and Veronica Lake. As a cold-blooded assassin seek vengeance for a double cross, he unwisely falls for the girlfriend of the cop who's pursuing him.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: (1953) Audrey Hepburn won her only Oscar in this romance as a bored princess who runs away from her duties and meets an American journalist (Gregory Peck), who shows her Rome.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: (1951) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a rancher who's the target of unwelcome harassment by his richer and more powerful neighbour. With Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew.

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: (2004) Drama. Dennis Quaid stars as the captain of an aircraft downed in the desert. There's no hope of rescue, unless he and the survivors can build another plane from the wreckage.

programme.title: Knock at the Cabin
programme.desc: (2023) M Night Shyamalan's jarringly intimate end-of-days horror with Dave Bautista. An armed group insist that a family of three must make an impossible life-or-death choice.

programme.title: Glass
programme.desc: (2019) M. Night Shyamalan directs an all-star cast in this genre-bending superhero sequel. Three superhumans team up to escape a psychiatric ward. With Bruce Willis in a cagoule.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: (1948) Historical adventure. A man (Louis Hayward) returns from the Wars of the Roses to learn from his uncle that a family friend has killed his father. But is everything as it seems?

programme.title: The Desert Fox
programme.desc: (1951) Drama. James Mason stars in Henry Hathaway's sympathetic portrait of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel in the final years of his life during the Second World War. With Jessica Tandy.

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: (1954) Western with Robert Mitchum and Marilyn Monroe. An ex-con and a saloon singer steer a raft through hostile territory to face a showdown with her crooked fiancé. With Rory Calhoun.

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: (1971) Film version of the popular comedy series set in 1940. The Walmington-on-Sea Home Guard, led by Arthur Lowe's Captain Mainwaring, bumble through a series of misadventures.

programme.title: Le Mans '66
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-winning sports drama starring Matt Damon and Christian Bale. In the 60s, Ford set out to build a car that can defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans race.

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: (2003) Superhero fantasy. Ben Affleck is a blind lawyer who turns vigilante by night. Jennifer Garner plays his lover and Colin Farrell the villain who endangers them both. Strong violence.

programme.title: The Last Duel
programme.desc: (2021) Historical drama from director Ridley Scott. Trial by combat is the only option to save a noblewoman's honour. With Jodie Comer, Matt Damon, Adam Driver and Ben Affleck.

programme.title: Wildfire
programme.desc: (2020) Tense drama set near Northern Ireland's border. When two sisters are reunited after one had disappeared, their lives become increasingly complicated as old wounds start to open.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Ten Tall Men
programme.desc: (1951) Comedy adventure. Burt Lancaster stars as a Foreign Legion sergeant leading nine men on a dangerous mission to prevent a Berber attack on a North African desert fort.

programme.title: To Hell and Back
programme.desc: (1955) Fact-based wartime drama. Audie Murphy, America's most decorated soldier in WWII, plays himself in this dramatic recreation of the valiant heroics that earned him the honours.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Oscar-winning actor Rami Malek discusses playing Freddie Mercury in the rock biopic about the rise of the band Queen.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: (1951) Western starring Randolph Scott. Four brothers leave the defeated South to seek jobs as the US recovers from the Civil War. As one becomes a railwayman, the others turn to crime.

programme.title: Siege of the Saxons
programme.desc: (1963) Dark ages adventure. King Arthur is murdered and usurped by his champion knight (Ronald Howard), so an outlaw (Ronald Lewis) seeks the mystic Merlin (John Laurie) to right the wrong.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: (1989) Star-studded tragi-comedy with Julia Roberts, Daryl Hannah, Dolly Parton and more. Six Southern belles console and cajole each other through life in a Louisiana beauty parlour.

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly-tinged but ultimately feel-good comedy starring Tom Hanks as a grumpy misanthrope who spends his time badgering people into following society's rules. But why is he like this?

programme.title: Bob Trevino Likes It
programme.desc: (2024) Tracie Laymon's bitter-sweet comedy drama stars Barbie Ferreira as a young woman who meets a man with the same name as her useless father and spots the opportunity for a reset...

programme.title: What Men Want
programme.desc: (2019) Romantic comedy starring Taraji P. Henson as a sports agent who uses her sudden ability to hear men's thoughts to her advantage.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: (1959) Satirical comedy starring Peter Sellers (in a triple role) and the original Doctor Who, William Hartnell. The world's smallest state, Grand Fenwick, declares war on the USA.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: (1953) Western. Rock Hudson stars as a California-bound settler who must ride 1500 miles to the Mexican border to rescue his fiancée (Donna Reed) after she's abducted by an outlaw.

programme.title: Shenandoah
programme.desc: (1965) Western. James Stewart stars as a wealthy Virginia farming patriarch trying to keep his family together and safe in the midst of the encroaching American Civil War.

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: (1959) Fantasy adventure starring James Mason, Pat Boone and Diane Baker. An expedition to the centre of the planet unexpectedly encounters a villainous rival and prehistoric beasts.

programme.title: Moon
programme.desc: (2009) Psychological sci-fi thriller. Sam Rockwell stars as a man who lives alone on the moon overseeing a mining operation. His time's nearly done, but he's started to go a bit peculiar...

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: (2014) Action-comedy with Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson. A London teenager is introduced to a secret society of immaculately dressed agents that exists to save the world.

programme.title: Bone Tomahawk
programme.desc: (2016) Wild West horror starring Kurt Russell, Lili Simmons, Patrick Wilson, Richard Jenkins and Matthew Fox. Can a posse save townsfolk from their cannibalistic abductors?

programme.title: Slow West
programme.desc: (2015) Violent offbeat western starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Michael Fassbender. A 16-year-old Scottish lad travels to 1870s Colorado on the trail of his true love.

programme.title: Local Hero

programme.title: Hidden Figures

programme.title: Midway

programme.title: Braveheart

programme.title: The Newsroom
programme.desc: The world's Newsroom brings you global events as they happen.. ¤ Category: Music & Radio.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Gamble Cheyenne helps an old friend by helping her keep her saloon from crooked gamblers. The woman's daughter who has been back east in school, will be arriving back in town soon, but she knows nothing about how her mother earned money for her education.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Greenhorn After suffering a great personal loss, 25-year-old Theodore Roosevelt abandons New York for the lawless Dakota Badlands. Along the way, he faces doubters and killers as he attempts to establish the Elkhorn Ranch and remake himself into a cattleman.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Frenchman Before it's up and running, Theodore Roosevelt's new Elkhorn Ranch is threatened by a powerful neighbor who attempts an underhanded land grab. To save his ranch, Roosevelt confronts his neighbor, the Marquis de Morés, and his beguiling wife, Medora.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E9 The Most Amazing Man Wade Randall comes to North Fork and mesmerizes children with big stories of his past gun battles with outlaws. Lucas suspects he is all talk and exposes the truth after Randall refuses to accept a shootout challenge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E10 Squeeze Play A land speculator named Willard Prescott contacts Lucas about buying his land as the railroad is fast approaching the area. He bribes Lucas and when he refuses, Prescott makes it clear he will stop at nothing to get his land, one way or the other.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E11 Gun Shy After one of Mark's friends dies due to a shooting accident, he is totally against his father having a rifle. Lucas explains in vain the need for a rifle on the frontier, leading to Mark running away. Meanwhile, Lou has problems with a wanted outlaw.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E12 The Anvil Chorus North Fork's blacksmith, Nils Swenson, volunteers to fill in for Marshal Micah Torrance while he is out of town. To keep the peace, Nils starts a policy that everyone turns in their gun upon entry to the town. His plan backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E7 Horsing Around Cody's rodeo is fast approaching and time is running out, so the cowboys head out to scout talent for the team-roping event. Misty's new barrel-racing horse has taken her training to a whole new level. So when Booger starts teasing her, she challenges him to a one-on-one race: cowboy vs barrel racer! Misty also comes up with a potential rodeo venue, so Cody heads out to Bay Minette, AL to lock down a site. Bubba and Kaley prepare for houseguest Andrew's family to arrive. Will Andrew finally find his own place, and get out of Kaley's hair? Meanwhile, the guys' reputation as cattle brokers starts to flourish. Booger gets a lead on a healthy herd of cattle in Texas, and the guys consider if they should go all-in and buy the entire herd. Booger heads back to the Lone Star State and strikes a deal that seems to be a win-win. But just as the guys get the ball rolling with another big deal, a phone call from their buyer puts everything in jeopardy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E8 Kiddie Corral The cowboys step a little outside of their comfort zones. Looking to offload their new herd, the guys head down to the local stockyard to hone their bartering skills. Cody bounces a crazy rodeo idea off the boys - then uses them guinea pigs. Bubba plans a short getaway with Kaley, but there's a big catch: Booger's been tapped as the babysitter, with Jaclyn lending a helping hand. Kaley wonders if Booger is up to the challenge. His first attempts to feed and dress little Andie suggest he most certainly is not! While Bubba and Kaley aren't sure they'll return home to find everything in one piece, they do get some great news from houseguest Andrew. Cody is desperate to find the final missing piece for his rodeo: an announcer. While Booger adamant that he's the perfect man for the job, Cody has to resort to using reverse psychology on his old friend to avoid disaster.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E30 Three-Legged Terror A troubled 18-year-old named Johnny Clover ransacks the North Fork Schoolhouse, stealing art supplies. Lucas later tries to help Johnny, but he lives with a controlling uncle who proves to be difficult to deal with.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E31 The Angry Man A neighboring rancher's son is seriously injured in an accident. With the young man's condition getting worse, Lucas learns the rancher won't take his son to the doctor since he feels his wife died from poor treatment.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Sergeant and the Kid A ten-year-old runaway named Joey Walker shows up at Fort Courage determined to enlist with the F Troop. O'Rourke tries to discourage the young boy by showing him that life there isn't glamorous. Meanwhile, tensions rise when Joey's mother arrives.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E19 What Are You Doing After the Massacre? A 147-year-old Hekawi Indian chief named Flaming Arrow attempts to win back the land from the United States Government starting with Fort Courage. He begins his attack by taking over the fort and trying to starve the F Troop until they surrender.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie's new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie's talent that she doesn't hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Trapper, Trader, Legend Although from humble beginnings, Tom Fitzpatrick is ambitious and intelligent. When he joins up with William Ashley's trapping expedition, he proves himself to be an invaluable member of the company, both as a hardy frontiersman and a shrewd businessman. Along with legendary mountain man Jedediah Smith, Fitzpatrick rediscovers the South Pass through the Rocky Mountains, opening the pathway that will enable western expansion for decades to come. Fitzpatrick quickly rises to the top of the fur trade and eventually takes over the company he once worked for, but he nearly loses everything when he takes a wrong turn while leading a supply train. Alone in the wilderness, he finds himself in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with a band of Gros Ventre warriors. Somehow, Fitzpatrick must survive the harrowing trek back to safety without a horse, gun, or supplies.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E1 A House Divided After the destruction of a Pony Express station in Rock Creek, Teaspoon, The Kid, and Jimmy receive an assignment to rebuild it. They must relocate and learn the new territory near town as well as the neighbors in the area.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E11 Renegades Cheyenne fulfills a dying war hero's wish and helps his son enlist in the Army. Cheyenne arrives at Fort Sumner with Jed Wayne, but trouble soon arises from a demanding colonel and the Comanche Indians' imminent uprising.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E12 The Empty Gun Cheyenne meets gunslinger Matt Reardon, who rescues him from a fight. Reardon asks for Cheyenne's help as he plans to aid the widow of a man he accidentally killed. However, the dead man's son as other plans for Reardon.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Spanish Grant The Cartwrights are in a battle over the validity of a Spanish land grant. They plan to stop the De La Cuesta family from seizing part of the Ponderosa along with all of the Carson Valley settlers' homestead lands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E13 Conflict While hunting, Lucas misses an easy shot at a cougar just a few feet away, and seconds from attacking Mark. After discovering that his gun is not the problem, Lucas begins to doubt his abilities with a rifle, leading him to do some soul-searching.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E14 Incident at Line Shack Six Railroad boss John Gangling runs an operation at Line Shack Six. Gangling pays his men in gold and when he finds that Charlie Been saves his wages in a money belt, he kills him for it. An innocent Indian who happens to stop by is accused of murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E15 Suspicion Lucas and Mark find Winslow Quince stranded in the desert with a broken wagon wheel. They stop to help, and when they get to North Fork with Quince, many note his gold coin purchases and lavish gifts. Lucas is suspicious, and townsfolk want answers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E16 The Sidewinder Gridley Maule comes to North Fork with revenge on his mind and confronts Lucas, who shot and killed his father years ago during a bank robbery. When Gridley tries to get Mark to fight, Micah puts him in jail, and Lou steps in to reform the young boy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E7 Horsing Around Cody's rodeo is fast approaching and time is running out, so the cowboys head out to scout talent for the team-roping event. Misty's new barrel-racing horse has taken her training to a whole new level. So when Booger starts teasing her, she challenges him to a one-on-one race: cowboy vs barrel racer! Misty also comes up with a potential rodeo venue, so Cody heads out to Bay Minette, AL to lock down a site. Bubba and Kaley prepare for houseguest Andrew's family to arrive. Will Andrew finally find his own place, and get out of Kaley's hair? Meanwhile, the guys' reputation as cattle brokers starts to flourish. Booger gets a lead on a healthy herd of cattle in Texas, and the guys consider if they should go all-in and buy the entire herd. Booger heads back to the Lone Star State and strikes a deal that seems to be a win-win. But just as the guys get the ball rolling with another big deal, a phone call from their buyer puts everything in jeopardy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E8 Kiddie Corral The cowboys step a little outside of their comfort zones. Looking to offload their new herd, the guys head down to the local stockyard to hone their bartering skills. Cody bounces a crazy rodeo idea off the boys - then uses them guinea pigs. Bubba plans a short getaway with Kaley, but there's a big catch: Booger's been tapped as the babysitter, with Jaclyn lending a helping hand. Kaley wonders if Booger is up to the challenge. His first attempts to feed and dress little Andie suggest he most certainly is not! While Bubba and Kaley aren't sure they'll return home to find everything in one piece, they do get some great news from houseguest Andrew. Cody is desperate to find the final missing piece for his rodeo: an announcer. While Booger adamant that he's the perfect man for the job, Cody has to resort to using reverse psychology on his old friend to avoid disaster.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E30 Three-Legged Terror A troubled 18-year-old named Johnny Clover ransacks the North Fork Schoolhouse, stealing art supplies. Lucas later tries to help Johnny, but he lives with a controlling uncle who proves to be difficult to deal with.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E31 The Angry Man A neighboring rancher's son is seriously injured in an accident. With the young man's condition getting worse, Lucas learns the rancher won't take his son to the doctor since he feels his wife died from poor treatment.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Sergeant and the Kid A ten-year-old runaway named Joey Walker shows up at Fort Courage determined to enlist with the F Troop. O'Rourke tries to discourage the young boy by showing him that life there isn't glamorous. Meanwhile, tensions rise when Joey's mother arrives.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E19 What Are You Doing After the Massacre? A 147-year-old Hekawi Indian chief named Flaming Arrow attempts to win back the land from the United States Government starting with Fort Courage. He begins his attack by taking over the fort and trying to starve the F Troop until they surrender.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie's new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie's talent that she doesn't hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E12 The Empty Gun Cheyenne meets gunslinger Matt Reardon, who rescues him from a fight. Reardon asks for Cheyenne's help as he plans to aid the widow of a man he accidentally killed. However, the dead man's son as other plans for Reardon.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Spanish Grant The Cartwrights are in a battle over the validity of a Spanish land grant. They plan to stop the De La Cuesta family from seizing part of the Ponderosa along with all of the Carson Valley settlers' homestead lands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E13 Conflict While hunting, Lucas misses an easy shot at a cougar just a few feet away, and seconds from attacking Mark. After discovering that his gun is not the problem, Lucas begins to doubt his abilities with a rifle, leading him to do some soul-searching.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E14 Incident at Line Shack Six Railroad boss John Gangling runs an operation at Line Shack Six. Gangling pays his men in gold and when he finds that Charlie Been saves his wages in a money belt, he kills him for it. An innocent Indian who happens to stop by is accused of murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E15 Suspicion Lucas and Mark find Winslow Quince stranded in the desert with a broken wagon wheel. They stop to help, and when they get to North Fork with Quince, many note his gold coin purchases and lavish gifts. Lucas is suspicious, and townsfolk want answers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E16 The Sidewinder Gridley Maule comes to North Fork with revenge on his mind and confronts Lucas, who shot and killed his father years ago during a bank robbery. When Gridley tries to get Mark to fight, Micah puts him in jail, and Lou steps in to reform the young boy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E9 Ride 'Em High Will all the hard work the cowboys put in this season finally pay off? Cody is hoping the people of Bay Minette will come out in droves to make his rodeo a rousing success, while Misty puts on her game face to take another shot at barrel-racing glory. Andrew's bags are finally packed and he's clearing out. Though Bubba and Kaley hate to see him go, they also love watching him leave! Since the cowboys have been buying cattle left and right, word's gotten out about the Faith Cattle Company's trading business. This leads to Booger and Bubba boarding a private jet to meet some Texas investors looking to place a make-or-break order. As the guys hustle to gather all the cattle in time, they find themselves bidding against an old friend at the sale barn. Rodeo night brings all the families together - and even Andrew makes a surprise appearance. As the season draws to a close, the cowboys have everything on the line: their own money, as well as their reputations.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S6 E1 Drone'T Knock It 'Til You Try It A ranching job in Texas inspires Cody to try and modernize their business with the help of technology, but Booger and Bubba are hesitant that it will be successful. Booger visits Matthew's school during parent's week to teach his classmates about cowboying. Bubba struggles with being away from his family for work and feels the pressure to keep their business close to home. A life-changing opportunity for Booger to compete at a world-renowned colt-starting competition leaves Cody and Bubba excited for their friend, but nervous about what it will mean for their business.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E32 The Woman The residents force Miss Adams, the North Fork schoolteacher, to leave her job because they feel she is too progressive for supporting women's right to vote. Lucas gets involved and he learns that lies have been circulated by a past student.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E33 The Money Gun Lucas has a disdain for Oat Jackford since years ago he burned down his ranch to get him off property he wanted. When hired killer Tom King arrives in North Fork and is on Oat's trail, Lucas decides to side with and help the man he once hated.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E20 A Horse of Another Color Captain Wilton Parmenter, known for his good, but often clumsy intentions, wants to capture a wild stallion for Wrangler Jane. However, Sergeant O' Rourke, always looking to make some money, intends to capture the horse and sell it to the circus.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E21 V Is for Vampire Count Sforza arrives at Fort Courage in a hearse with a pet crow he calls Brother. The men of F Troop think he's a vampire due to his pale complexion. When Wrangler Jane goes missing, they go to Sforza's spooky mansion.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E3 Jim Beckwourth: War Chief of the Crow When former slave Jim Beckwourth heads west to seek work as a trapper, he begins what will become one of the most eventful, heroic lives of all the mountain men. As a joke, one of Beckwourth's fellow trappers tells a group of Crow warriors that Beckwourth is a long-lost member of their tribe, and the adventure begins. Adopted by the Crow, Beckwourth joins them in a series of ferocious battles with other tribes, becomes a war chief, and falls in love with a fierce female warrior named Pine Leaf. He then uses his hard-won influence with the Crow to convince them to provide furs to the powerful American Fur Company. But an unexpected visit from legendary trapper and old friend Tom Fitzpatrick sets off a violent collision that forces Beckwourth to choose between the two worlds he loves.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E2 Jesse A young man named Jesse is out for revenge on a gang of outlaws responsible for his guardian's death. The riders befriend and protect Jesse by stepping in and taking him to Rock Creek before it is too late.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E13 White Warrior Cheyenne leads a wagon train and goes through Apache territory. Along the way, he meets a band of braves and tries to free a teenage captive from them. However, the young man isn't sure that he wants to be free.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E14 Ghost of the Cimarron Cheyenne travels with an outlaw gang led by the Ghost of the Cimarron. The gang forces him to aid a wounded gunman. Danger looms for Cheyenne as he is mistaken as a gang member by lawmen and their posse.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E4 Blood on the Land A vile and murderous sheepherder, Jeb Drummond, contrives a plan to have Adam Cartwright taken hostage in an attempt to blackmail Ben and force him to sign over a large section of Ponderosa land.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E17 The Sixteenth Cousin The big day finally arrives in North Fork as the first train comes to town. Onboard are Lucas and Mark along with a Japanese nobleman and his servant. When bullies harass the foreign visitors, the pair quickly teaches them a lesson in good manners.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E18 Hostages to Fortune On Halloween, Mark and his friends wear masks and go from ranch to ranch to play pranks. Knowing the boys will be blamed, rustlers wear similar masks to steal cattle. Lucas thinks the boys are mixed up in the theft, until he finds out the truth.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E19 And the Devil Makes Five While returning from a hunting trip, Lucas and Mark meet Marshal Micah Torrance who is escorting prisoner Scully Potter to trial. Later in camp, Lucas' life is suddenly in danger when a rattlesnake is found in his bedroll. Potter tries to escape.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E20 End of the Hunt Lucas wants to kill an old enemy, Reef Jackson, who is coming to North Fork. In the past, Jackson shot Lucas in the back and tried to steal his wife. Micah puts Lucas in jail to stop him from getting his revenge. Meanwhile, Mark wants to bag an elk.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E9 Ride 'Em High Will all the hard work the cowboys put in this season finally pay off? programme.desc: S5 E19 And the Devil Makes Five While returning from a hunting trip, Lucas and Mark meet Marshal Micah Torrance who is escorting prisoner Scully Potter to trial. Later in camp, Lucas' life is suddenly in danger when a rattlesnake is found in his bedroll. Potter tries to escape.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E20 End of the Hunt Lucas wants to kill an old enemy, Reef Jackson, who is coming to North Fork. In the past, Jackson shot Lucas in the back and tried to steal his wife. Micah puts Lucas in jail to stop him from getting his revenge. Meanwhile, Mark wants to bag an elk.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S6 E2 Obstacle Horse, of Course of Course With no plans on how to expand their business in sight, the cowboys head to Texas for work. After attending a special cattle sale for Misty's business, Full Moon Cattle, Cody comes up with a possible new business venture. Booger begins training for the Road to the Horse competition, but things don't go smoothly. Feeling like he's in over his head, he receives good advice from an unexpected source. A hand injury affects how much work Bubba can do, but he uses the downtime to build a mock obstacle course for Booger. Kaley tells Bubba about her desire to get into real estate and encourages him to think about a possible career change. Booger challenges Misty to compete against him in the obstacle course, and Jaclyn receives a crash course in barrel racing.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S6 E3 Unsaddled and Unraveled Booger heads to Austin to work with a former contestant in preparation for the Road to the Horse competition. He quickly realizes that there's more to this competition than handling a colt, and presentation has a lot to do with his score. Cody finds the perfect herd to start a special cattle sale and shares his idea for the business with Bubba, but he is hesitant. Once Booger is back, the cowboys meet to discuss the future of their business, but they don't all see eye-to-eye. Cody and Bubba want to be supportive of Booger but are frustrated that his dedication to the Road to the Horse competition has taken priority over their business. The lack of direction causes tension between the cowboys. Feeling divided, they all start to question the future of their business.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E34 A Matter of Faith A trail bum rides into North Fork during one of the worst droughts in years. He claims that he can bring rain to their town. Many believe that he's a water witcher, but a railroad boss resents his intrusion and wants him gone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E35 Blood Brothers Lucas finds a wounded man, takes him to the North Fork doctor, and gives blood to help save the stranger's life. Marshal Torrance won't help as he says he knows the man and wants him dead. Things become more complicated when vigilantes ride to town.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E22 That's Show Biz Corporal Agarn decides to leave the army and Fort Courage to become the manager of a rock band called The Bedbugs. The group appeals to Agarn as they seem ahead of their time. Not to be outdone, O'Rourke forms a group called The Termites.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E23 The Day They Shot Agarn Agarn is escorting a dangerous prisoner but the man escapes. Agarn reports the incident to his major, only to find out that he must take the man's place in prison. O'Rourke goes after the prisoner, but tragedy unfolds.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Texas Fence-Cutting War When homesteaders keep cutting down her fences to access grazing land and water, a widowed landowner teams up with famed Texas Ranger Ira Aten to protect her property. Aten hopes his explosive plan of action will force the cutters to compromise.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E11 Battle Beneath the Mountain For months, a thin wall of rock is all that keeps the peace between two rival silver mining companies 300 feet below the Idaho desert. When the barrier is finally breached, pickaxes give way to pistols and rifles, and the miners battle for five days.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E3 The Blood of Others Lou, Jimmy, and The Kid are on a mission of taking a long-sought-after outlaw to hang. On the way, The Kid is injured, but the others continue without him. They are confronted by a vindictive ex-sheriff who's bent on killing the man before he hangs.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E15 Wagon-Tongue North Cheyenne takes on the role of trail boss to help a woman get her herd of cattle to town. He realizes that the man he shot in self-defense is her late husband. More problems arise when he deals with a crew of disobedient trail hands.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E16 The Long Search Cheyenne joins in the search for a missing 10-year-old boy along with the help of a Sioux boy named Char. While the boy finds himself trapped by a cave-in, the locals find his horse nearby and suspect the Sioux took him.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E5 Desert Justice When a U.S. Marshal arrests one of the Ponderosa's workers for murder and takes him to Los Angeles for trial, Hoss and Adam go to make sure the marshal doesn't kill the accused before they get there.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E21 The Bullet While traveling, Lucas rescues a man named Griff, a corrupt gambling hall owner. When he reports Griff to the marshal, Lucas learns that a missing friend of his is dead and the marshal is using a new science called ballistics to solve the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E22 Requiem at Mission Springs Mark is paralyzed after falling off his horse. When Doc Burrage suggests that warm mineral baths could help him recover, Lucas and Lou take Mark to the old Mission Springs. However, danger lies ahead when escapees arrive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E23 The Guest A charming man named Mario Rosati arrives at the McCain Ranch and introduces himself as an acquaintance of an old family friend. Lucas and Mark offer him a place to stay for a few days, but they learn that he has an ulterior motive: to kill Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E24 Old Man Running An old man named Sam Gibbs comes to North Fork in need of Marshal Micah Torrance's protection from criminals who are after him. Sam happens to be Mark's grandfather and Lucas' deceased wife's father. Lucas finds peace with his past and helps Sam.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S6 E2 Obstacle Horse, of Course of Course With no plans on how to expand their business in sight, the cowboys head to Texas for work. After attending a special cattle sale for Misty's business, Full Moon Cattle, Cody comes up with a possible new business venture. Booger begins training for the Road to the Horse competition, but things don't go smoothly. Feeling like he's in over his head, he receives good advice from an unexpected source. A hand injury affects how much work Bubba can do, but he uses the downtime to build a mock obstacle course for Booger. Kaley tells Bubba about her desire to get into real estate and encourages him to think about a possible career change. Booger challenges Misty to compete against him in the obstacle course, and Jaclyn receives a crash course in barrel racing.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S6 E3 Unsaddled and Unraveled Booger heads to Austin to work with a former contestant in preparation for the Road to the Horse competition. He quickly realizes that there's more to this competition than handling a colt, and presentation has a lot to do with his score. Cody finds the perfect herd to start a special cattle sale and shares his idea for the business with Bubba, but he is hesitant. Once Booger is back, the cowboys meet to discuss the future of their business, but they don't all see eye-to-eye. Cody and Bubba want to be supportive of Booger but are frustrated that his dedication to the Road to the Horse competition has taken priority over their business. The lack of direction causes tension between the cowboys. Feeling divided, they all start to question the future of their business.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E34 A Matter of Faith A trail bum rides into North Fork during one of the worst droughts in years. He claims that he can bring rain to their town. Many believe that he's a water witcher, but a railroad boss resents his intrusion and wants him gone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E35 Blood Brothers Lucas finds a wounded man, takes him to the North Fork doctor, and gives blood to help save the stranger's life. Marshal Torrance won't help as he says he knows the man and wants him dead. Things become more complicated when vigilantes ride to town.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E22 That's Show Biz Corporal Agarn decides to leave the army and Fort Courage to become the manager of a rock band called The Bedbugs. The group appeals to Agarn as they seem ahead of their time. Not to be outdone, O'Rourke forms a group called The Termites.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E23 The Day They Shot Agarn Agarn is escorting a dangerous prisoner but the man escapes. Agarn reports the incident to his major, only to find out that he must take the man's place in prison. O'Rourke goes after the prisoner, but tragedy unfolds.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Texas Fence-Cutting War When homesteaders keep cutting down her fences to access grazing land and water, a widowed landowner teams up with famed Texas Ranger Ira Aten to protect her property. Aten hopes his explosive plan of action will force the cutters to compromise.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E11 Battle Beneath the Mountain For months, a thin wall of rock is all that keeps the peace between two rival silver mining companies 300 feet below the Idaho desert. When the barrier is finally breached, pickaxes give way to pistols and rifles, and the miners battle for five days.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E3 The Blood of Others Lou, Jimmy, and The Kid are on a mission of taking a long-sought-after outlaw to hang. On the way, The Kid is injured, but the others continue without him. They are confronted by a vindictive ex-sheriff who's bent on killing the man before he hangs.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E15 Wagon-Tongue North Cheyenne takes on the role of trail boss to help a woman get her herd of cattle to town. He realizes that the man he shot in self-defense is her late husband. More problems arise when he deals with a crew of disobedient trail hands.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E16 The Long Search Cheyenne joins in the search for a missing 10-year-old boy along with the help of a Sioux boy named Char. While the boy finds himself trapped by a cave-in, the locals find his horse nearby and suspect the Sioux took him.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E5 Desert Justice When a U.S. Marshal arrests one of the Ponderosa's workers for murder and takes him to Los Angeles for trial, Hoss and Adam go to make sure the marshal doesn't kill the accused before they get there.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E21 The Bullet While traveling, Lucas rescues a man named Griff, a corrupt gambling hall owner. When he reports Griff to the marshal, Lucas learns that a missing friend of his is dead and the marshal is using a new science called ballistics to solve the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E22 Requiem at Mission Springs Mark is paralyzed after falling off his horse. When Doc Burrage suggests that warm mineral baths could help him recover, Lucas and Lou take Mark to the old Mission Springs. However, danger lies ahead when escapees arrive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E23 The Guest A charming man named Mario Rosati arrives at the McCain Ranch and introduces himself as an acquaintance of an old family friend. Lucas and Mark offer him a place to stay for a few days, but they learn that he has an ulterior motive: to kill Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E24 Old Man Running An old man named Sam Gibbs comes to North Fork in need of Marshal Micah Torrance's protection from criminals who are after him. Sam happens to be Mark's grandfather and Lucas' deceased wife's father. Lucas finds peace with his past and helps Sam.

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: When a card shark receives a letter from a distant and troubled son, he travels to rescue the boy and his mother. During a train ride, the gambler meets a friendly, prideful young card player and shares his wisdom.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E36 Stranger at Night Coming home from school, Mark stumbles upon a dead man's body. Lucas discovers he was stabbed and the only clue is a belt with the initials R.M. Lucas leaves Mark with Artemus Quarles, a cousin who is visiting. Quarles, however, is not who he seems.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E37 The Raid A renegade Apache named Chaqua raids the McCain Ranch and kidnaps Mark. Lucas gathers a group of men to get Mark back, but Chaqua plans to make him an Apache warrior since he lost his own son. Lucas will stop at nothing to get his son back to safety.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S3 E1 The Malachi Hobart Story Duke scouts a new passage through rough terrain. He meets a traveling preacher named Malachi Hobart during his trip. However, he soon discovers that Hobart is nothing more than a con man. Duke devises a plan to expose him.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E7 Doc Susie Goes Underground After the suspicious death of a tunnel worker, and unconvincing answers from the project's lead engineer, Doc Susie goes on a covert mission to find out what happened. Deep underground, she finds her own life in peril when she's trapped by a cave-in.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E10 Jim Roberts Cleans Up Jerome In his first week on the job as the new constable of Jerome, Arizona, Jim Roberts gets to work arresting the town's troublemakers and teaching his timid deputy how to be a courageous lawman as they track down a stone-cold killer and his gang.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E8 William Sublette: King of the Fur Trade In his quest to become king of the fur trade, William Sublette revolutionizes the industry and puts his life on the line in the process. But he may risk too much when he rushes to save his comrades in the largest battle of the mountain man era.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E4 Between Rock Creek and a Hard Place After getting in an argument with a Union Army recruiter, Noah becomes the prime suspect of murder when the recruiter turns up dead. The riders become involved in the investigation. Meanwhile, Noah befriends Quinn and his sister Cassie.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E13 Death at Dawn When a member of a powerful gang of outlaws murders a local shopkeeper, the killer is sentenced to be hanged. The leader of the gang kidnaps Ben and holds him hostage in an attempt to gain the killer's freedom.

programme.title: The Young Land
programme.desc: When an American gunslinger kills a Mexican man in California immediately in the aftermath of the Mexican-American War, he is arrested and put on trial for murder. The local population is anxious to see if justice will prevail.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E9 New Beginnings Bubba and Kaley welcome their baby girl into the world. When they get home from the hospital, Kaley surprises Bubba with a special gift. Cody lands a big contracting job with a local rancher, but the work needs to be completed in a week. He needs this job to fund the construction of his dream home, so he must get the work done somehow. Booger is beginning to think that Jaclyn might be the one, so he decides to introduce her to his grandma. Finally, the whole gang gets together for a Faith Cattle family barbecue to meet baby Andie.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E10 Season Round Up This special edition of The Cowboy Way: Alabama revisits the action from Season One as cowboy trio Bubba, Cody and Booger build their cattle business. Of course the guys have their hands full wrangling cattle and taming unruly horses, but their personal lives are just as action-packed. Newlyweds Bubba and Cody are getting used to being family men, while Booger struggles through a series of dates on a quest to find the love of his life. Chock-full of season highlights as well as hilarious never-before-seen outtakes, it's an entertaining look at the cowboy way of life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E16 Mail Order Groom A mail-order husband arrives in North Fork, and finds not only a bride, but also harassment from two local troublemakers.

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: When a card shark receives a letter from a distant and troubled son, he travels to rescue the boy and his mother. During a train ride, the gambler meets a friendly, prideful young card player and shares his wisdom.

programme.title: They Call Me Trinity
programme.desc: When a land-hungry rancher sends his bullies to harass peace-loving Mormons into giving up their fertile valley, a lazy gunfighter with a very quick draw and amazing accuracy, along with his horse-thieving brother, come to the settlers' rescue.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E17 The Sixteenth Cousin The big day finally arrives in North Fork as the first train comes to town. Onboard are Lucas and Mark along with a Japanese nobleman and his servant. When bullies harass the foreign visitors, the pair quickly teaches them a lesson in good manners.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E4 Blood on the Land A vile and murderous sheepherder, Jeb Drummond, contrives a plan to have Adam Cartwright taken hostage in an attempt to blackmail Ben and force him to sign over a large section of Ponderosa land.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E2 William Bartram: America's First Great Naturalist Naturalist William Bartram explores the unmapped regions of the South to document the native fauna and flora. After surviving many encounters with Native Americans and wildlife, it's an invisible virus that may finally end the journey and his life.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Greenhorn After suffering a great personal loss, 25-year-old Theodore Roosevelt abandons New York for the lawless Dakota Badlands. Along the way, he faces doubters and killers as he attempts to establish the Elkhorn Ranch and remake himself into a cattleman.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Frenchman Before it's up and running, Theodore Roosevelt's new Elkhorn Ranch is threatened by a powerful neighbor who attempts an underhanded land grab. To save his ranch, Roosevelt confronts his neighbor, the Marquis de Morés, and his beguiling wife, Medora.

programme.title: This Gun for Hire
programme.desc: (1942) Classic noir starring Alan Ladd and Veronica Lake. As a cold-blooded assassin seek vengeance for a double cross, he unwisely falls for the girlfriend of the cop who's pursuing him.

programme.title: Roman Holiday

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: (1951) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a rancher who's the target of unwelcome harassment by his richer and more powerful neighbour. With Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew.

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: (2004) Drama. Dennis Quaid stars as the captain of an aircraft downed in the desert. There's no hope of rescue, unless he and the survivors can build another plane from the wreckage.

programme.title: Knock at the Cabin
programme.desc: (2023) M Night Shyamalan's jarringly intimate end-of-days horror with Dave Bautista. An armed group insist that a family of three must make an impossible life-or-death choice.

programme.title: Glass
programme.desc: (2019) M. Night Shyamalan directs an all-star cast in this genre-bending superhero sequel. Three superhumans team up to escape a psychiatric ward. With Bruce Willis in a cagoule.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.
